data.title: I, Rhoda: Harper, Valerie, Harper, Valerie: 9781442361935: Amazon.com: Books
data.meta_description: I, Rhoda [Harper, Valerie, Harper, Valerie] on Amazon.com. *FREE* shipping on qualifying offers. I, Rhoda
data.text:
Customers find the book entertaining and mention it's a great read. They also appreciate Valerie Harper's talent, charm, and unflagging sunny disposition.

"...The book is a great read for anyone who has been a fan of the Rhoda and/or Mary Tyler Moore shows, or even for those who enjoy reading first-person..." Read more

"...But, that's ok. She wrote the book she wanted to and it's enjoyable." Read more

"AMAZINGLY good read. Having watched "Rhoda" reruns for years, and also MTM Show reruns, I only knew Valerie as Rhoda Morgenstern...." Read more

Customers find the book heartfelt, with interesting anecdotes and a great insight into Valerie's life. They also say the tone is upbeat and positive throughout, and the book is entertaining and revealing. Customers also mention that the explanation of events is amazing.

"...The book is highly detailed on the one hand - discussing how she made friends, how she got her jobs, who she appreciates, how she achieved her goals..." Read more

"...The book is not incredibly introspective and doesn't delve too deeply into big, deep, dark secrets. It won't change your life! But, that's ok...." Read more

"...Her autobiography is a really delightful read and if you are one of the millions who loved Rhoda, you should definitely read it...." Read more

"...and you will be sure that such a wonderful, determined, warm and passionate person as Ms. Harper can certainly do that. And more." Read more

Customers find the writing style engaging, wonderful, and honest. They also appreciate the matter-of-fact style without using profanity or resorting to gossip. Readers also mention the book reads fast, fun, and light.

"...section about her experiences with the TV sitcom in the 80's, Valerie, honest and up front. I do remember that show well, and I was a huge fan of it...." Read more

Customers find the writing quality of the book amazing, talented, and down to earth. They also say the author takes them into her wonderful life.

"...wants to read a story about a celebrity - a human being - who is a class act, passionate, funny and real." Read more

"...Very interesting life this lady led. Very talented and versatile. She danced, sang, t.v., movies and stage...." Read more

"...It really touched my heart and spirit. Ms. Harper takes you into her wonderful life. From her birth to how she began her super career...." Read more

Customers find the book honest, realistic, and humble. They also describe the author as kind, positive, and giving. Readers also mention that Valerie is determined, warm, and passionate.

"...about Valerie that I noticed is that she has a mix of old-fashioned values of discretion, wisdom and family closeness, combined with an open-minded..." Read more

"...all the things I read about her life in this book, with strength, pragmatism, honesty, and love...." Read more

"...Read the book and you will be sure that such a wonderful, determined, warm and passionate person as Ms. Harper can certainly do that. And more." Read more

"...book is just a reflection of the type of person she really is, i.e., kind, positive, giving...." Read more

"...Such a fun read! She really speaks from the heart. So MANY great Hollywood stories..." Read more

"...She wrote it the way she speaks. I loved all of the background stories about her childhood, her time on Broadway, and how she got into T.V. She had..." Read more

"Well written, great story of the trials of a rise to success, along with heartfelt reflections on a life well lived!..." Read more

"...She is the real deal. This is a great story." Read more

"...Everything that leads up to this point is well-crafted, moves at a nice pace, and it shows how hard Valerie worked to get there...." Read more
